summary: Anne B Misita is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents detail her position and salary during that period. The consistent appearance of her name across these payroll documents indicates her sustained employment with the HSCA during its investigation.
significance: Anne B Misita's significance lies in her being a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role isn't detailed in the provided summaries, her presence on payroll records confirms her involvement in the committee's work.
